document.heading: REDISTRICTING PROCEDURE AMENDMENT ACT OF 1991 CLARIFICATION AMENDMENT ACT OF 1991, BILL 9-314

history.narrative: Law 9-65 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-314, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 5, 1991, and December 3, 1991, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 20, 1991, it was assigned Act No. 9-116 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: ENROLLMENT(S) kwiktag 103 248 572 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 9-65 "Redistricting Procedure Amendment Act of 1991 Clarification and Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986 Extension Amendment Act of 1991 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 9-314 on first and second readings, November 5, 1991, and December 3, 1991, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on December 20, 1991, this legislation was assigned Act No. 9-116, published in the January 3, 1992, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 39 page 8) and transmitted to Congress on January 7, 1992 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 9-65, effective March 11, 1992 j.~LSON hairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: January February March 21,22,23,24,27,28,29,30,31 3,4,5,6,7,18,19,20,21,24,25,26,27,28 2,3,4,5,6,9,10 Btttlllttd Original AN ACT D,C, ACT 9-i16 IN TIIE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA DECEMBER 20, 1991 To amend the Redistricting Procedure Act of 1981, as amended by the Redistricting Procedure Amendment Act of 1991, to clarify the legal description of the boundary between Wards 2 and 6; and to amend the Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986 to extend the Free Clinic Assistance Program Act for 5 years. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Redistricting Procedure Amendment Act of 1991 Clarification and Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986 Extension Amendment Act of 1991 Sec. 2. Section 4 of the Redistricting Procedure Act of 1991, effective August 17, 1991 (D.C. Law 9-26; to be codified at D.C. Code §1-1333 is amended by striking the phrase "thence south along said South Capitol Street and continuing the projection of South Capitol Street south to the center line of the Anacostia River wherever it appears and inserting the phrase "thence south along said South Capitol Street and continuing southeasterly along said South Capitol Street to the midpoint of the Frederick Douglass Memorial Bridge center line of the Anacostia River in its place. Sec. 3. Section 7(b) of the Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986, effective September 23, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-155; D.C. Code §1-308.1 note is amended to read as follows b) This act shall expire 10 years after its having taken effect Sec. 4. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C. Code §1-233(c)(1 and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of New Section 1-333 Section 1-308.1 Ol’iginal Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations.
